message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.SI 

This paper proposes a method for optimizing multivariate performance measures from multi-view data, which involves learning linear discriminant functions for each view and combining them to construct an overall multivariate mapping function. This problem is related to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational linguistics (cs.CL), and social and information networks (cs.SI). However, given the focus on learning discriminant functions and optimizing performance measures, cs.LG and cs.CV are the most likely sub-categories.
